title: [BEAM-13203] Deprecate SnsIO.writeAsync for AWS Sdk v2 due to risk of data loss.
body:
The design (and implementation) of `SnsIO.writeAsync` is broken both with respect to the beam programming model as well as general async programming: - Output for a bundle may be emitted even after the bundle is finished (lack of join / waiting for pending futures), additionally output is emitted from multiple threads risking concurrent modification issues on underlying data structures. - Exceptions disappear into the void (respective tests are broken as they don't throw asynchronously and could make one think this works). - Parallelism is unlimited causing the writer to instantly accumulate everything into memory. `BEAM-13563` will allow to later change `SnsIO.write` into an async implementation without any breaking changes. That should be the right time to implement things throughly and address above issues. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-13605] Modify groupby.apply implementation in preparation for pandas 1.4.0
body:
pandas 1.4.0 changes the logic used for [transform detection](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/dev/whatsnew/v1.4.0.html#groupby-apply-consistent-transform-detection), which breaks our implementation of `apply`. Specifically, detecting transforms using index equality _does not work_ for Beam DataFrames, since it requires observing the actual index values at pipeline construction time. In addition, the fact that pandas does it breaks some of our internal usages since some partitions can have equal indexes, and other partitions can have unequal indexes, leading to results that are different between partitions. This PR modifies our implementation of `apply` so that it does _not_ defer to pandas' `apply` when it's transform detection will lead to inconsistent results. It also documents this new divergence from pandas (i.e. our `apply` implementation will never detect a transform via index equality). `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------

title: [BEAM-13799] Create an Interactive Beam Dataproc package for users to manage clusters with
body:
- Adds a package to support the creation of Dataproc clusters that have been configured with a Flink session - By default, a created Dataproc cluster will be called 'interactive-beam-cluster' - Users additionally will have the ability to: - specify a name of their choosing for the created cluster, a warning is raised to notify the user that they will have to delete the cluster on their own - delete the cluster with the default name, 'interactive-beam-cluster' - ASF Jira thread: [[BEAM-13799]](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-13799) ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-4665] Allow joining a running dataflow pipeline without throwing
body:
Right now, if you try to run a dataflow pipeline with a defined name in async mode multiple times in a row it throws the second time because a job already exists: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42773683/152037935-35bb15e0-078b-42ac-b0e8-deac0e0f4cd7.png) This updates the behavior to just join the existing pipeline and not throw: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42773683/152038185-e0fc0c33-a466-46f6-a17d-0d78b1e2fc64.png) ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-13779] Fix labeler trigger
body:
https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/16665 doesn't quite work because the labeler action requires token permissions that can't be given to forks for security permissions. Since prs execute the code that is in the fork, that is a security issue. Fortunately, GitHub introduced a trigger to work around this which will use the main repo's code, not the forks. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-13740] Correctly install go before running tests
body:
This correctly runs setup-go before some of our java and python tests. The previous iteration had 2 issues that caused it to not work: 1) The matrix strategy was incorrectly specified as: `runs-on: [ubuntu-latest, macos-latest, windows-latest]` instead of ``` runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }} strategy: fail-fast: false matrix: os: [ubuntu-latest, macos-latest, windows-latest] ``` (in fairness, I found at least 1 place where the docs on this were wrong) 2) Putting the setup-go step in its own job won't actually impact anything because new runners are spun up for each job if we're using the hosted service This corrects both of those things and adds setup-go back in ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-13781] Exclude grpc-netty-shaded from gax-grpc's dependency
body:
During the RC1 for 2.36.0 release, it's reported that the following dependency conflicts: ``` Could not resolve version conflict among [ org.apache.beam:beam-sdks-java-io-google-cloud-platform:jar:2.36.0 -> org.apache.beam:beam-sdks-java-extensions-google-cloud-platform-core:jar:2.36.0 -> com.google.cloud.bigdataoss:gcsio:jar:2.2.4 -> io.grpc:grpc-netty-shaded:jar:1.41.1 org.apache.beam:beam-sdks-java-io-google-cloud-platform:jar:2.36.0 -> com.google.api:gax-grpc:jar:2.8.1 -> io.grpc:grpc-netty-shaded:jar:1.42.1 org.apache.beam:beam-sdks-java-io-google-cloud-platform:jar:2.36.0 -> com.google.api:gax-grpc:jar:2.8.1 -> io.grpc:grpc-xds:jar:1.42.1 -> io.grpc:grpc-netty-shaded:jar:[1.42.1,1.42.1] org.apache.beam:beam-sdks-java-io-google-cloud-platform:jar:2.36.0 -> com.google.cloud:google-cloud-bigquerystorage:jar:2.8.1 -> io.grpc:grpc-netty-shaded:jar:1.43.2 org.apache.beam:beam-sdks-java-io-google-cloud-platform:jar:2.36.0 -> com.google.cloud.bigtable:bigtable-client-core:jar:1.25.1 -> com.google.cloud:google-cloud-bigtable:jar:1.27.1 -> io.grpc:grpc-netty-shaded:jar:1.39.0 org.apache.beam:beam-sdks-java-io-google-cloud-platform:jar:2.36.0 -> com.google.cloud.bigtable:bigtable-client-core:jar:1.25.1 -> io.grpc:grpc-netty-shaded:jar:1.39.0 org.apache.beam:beam-sdks-java-io-google-cloud-platform:jar:2.36.0 -> com.google.cloud:google-cloud-firestore:jar:3.0.10 -> io.grpc:grpc-netty-shaded:jar:1.43.2 org.apache.beam:beam-sdks-java-io-google-cloud-platform:jar:2.36.0 -> com.google.cloud:google-cloud-pubsublite:jar:1.4.8 -> io.grpc:grpc-netty-shaded:jar:1.43.2 org.apache.beam:beam-sdks-java-io-google-cloud-platform:jar:2.36.0 -> com.google.cloud:google-cloud-pubsub:jar:1.115.1 -> io.grpc:grpc-netty-shaded:jar:1.43.2 org.apache.beam:beam-sdks-java-io-google-cloud-platform:jar:2.36.0 -> com.google.cloud:google-cloud-spanner:jar:6.17.4 -> io.grpc:grpc-netty-shaded:jar:1.43.2 org.apache.beam:beam-sdks-java-io-google-cloud-platform:jar:2.36.0 -> io.grpc:grpc-alts:jar:1.43.2 -> io.grpc:grpc-netty-shaded:jar:[1.43.2,1.43.2] org.apache.beam:beam-sdks-java-io-google-cloud-platform:jar:2.36.0 -> io.grpc:grpc-netty-shaded:jar:1.43.2 ] ``` Among these lines, the problematic ones are the following two that forces conflicting version for grpc-netty-shaded. - `org.apache.beam:beam-sdks-java-io-google-cloud-platform:jar:2.36.0 -> com.google.api:gax-grpc:jar:2.8.1 -> io.grpc:grpc-xds:jar:1.42.1 -> io.grpc:grpc-netty-shaded:jar:[1.42.1,1.42.1]` - `org.apache.beam:beam-sdks-java-io-google-cloud-platform:jar:2.36.0 -> io.grpc:grpc-alts:jar:1.43.2 -> io.grpc:grpc-netty-shaded:jar:[1.43.2,1.43.2]` This pull request excludes grpc-netty-shaded from the dependency declaration from first one (gax-grpc) in `BeamModulePlugin.groovy`. # How did I confirm the effect? `./gradlew -Ppublishing -PskipCheckerFramework -p sdks/java/io/google-cloud-platform publishMavenJavaPublicationToMavenLocal` installs the Maven artifact of beam-sdks-java-io-google-cloud-platform to the local Maven repository. Before the change, `~/.m2/repository/org/apache/beam/beam-sdks-java-io-google-cloud-platform/2.37.0-SNAPSHOT/beam-sdks-java-io-google-cloud-platform-2.37.0-SNAPSHOT.pom ` had: ``` com.google.api gax-grpc compile org.checkerframework jdk8 com.google.guava guava-jdk5 jdk.tools jdk.tools com.google.protobuf protobuf-lite org.hamcrest hamcrest-all ``` Also a simple Maven project that depends on beam-sdks-java-io-google-cloud-platform failed (https://gist.github.com/suztomo/ba04d69f4501cf563ad3dc3cf96baf5f). After this PR, it has ``` com.google.api gax-grpc compile org.checkerframework jdk8 com.google.guava guava-jdk5 jdk.tools jdk.tools com.google.protobuf protobuf-lite org.hamcrest hamcrest-all io.grpc grpc-netty-shaded ``` (Notice the exclusion of `grpc-netty-shaded` at the end.) When I ran the Maven project that depends on beam-sdks-java-io-google-cloud-platform, it succeeds (https://gist.github.com/suztomo/357d964089ad6ce049c89eb30f89dd51). # The root cause The root cause of the problem is the GCP Libraries BOM (which I maintain) provides conflicting gRPC versions in the libraries. I'll enhance our release process to include the check in gRPC version convergence in future. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-13399, BEAM-13683] Eagerly materialize artifacts for automated expansion service, add feature to SQL transform
body:
Adds eager artifact materialization for automated expansion service queries, avoiding leaking resources when used and allowing the service to be torn down after the `Expand()` call. This is achieved by adding a new `HandlerFunc` to manage this and logic in `getHandlerFunc()` to pass it back when needed. The SQL transform wrapper is modified to use this functionality when no expansion address is provided, and the written SQL example in the repository passes using this approach. NOTE: the service start-up code depends on the Beam version found in `core/core.go` and the Beam version must be a non-dev release version with published JARs on Maven. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-13780] Add CONTRIBUTING.md pointing to main guide
body:
Add back a stripped down contribution guide. Not having this was a small piece of friction on getting started with my first contribution - it used to exist, and was removed (possibly mistakenly - https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/10366#issuecomment-573992574). Having an explicit CONTRIBUTING.md makes a couple discoverability things easier, mostly it would: 1) Help new contributors find the guide more quickly (extra helpful for people who don't necessarily need to read through the beam model, e.g. users, and people who are actively making their first contributions and want to reference it quickly) 2) Use GitHub's built in support to link the contribution guide when users open their first pr. 3) If we switch to issues, automatically point to the contribution guide when/before users create their first issue as well. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-13779] Fix pr labeling
body:
This replaces probot autolabeling with a GitHub Action to do the same. Probot has been deprecated and hasn't been labeling PRs in a while, but the config already exists to do it. Having this would be nice so that we can quickly answer questions like: what are all of the Go PRs that have been completed recently. This is extra nice for new contributors (like me) who are trying to find their way around the repo/recent changes. Note that because the Action uses slightly different glob matching I had to update the patterns in autolabeler.yml Here's an example PR where the labeler is working - https://github.com/damccorm/beam/pull/1 ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42773683/151863356-9faf8f17-6e4e-40d4-a80a-50737affc943.png) ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-12792] Install pipeline dependencies to temporary venv
body:
The change allows users to submit multiple pipelines to the same SDK container without dependency conflicts. Dependencies in `--setup_only` mode are still installed globally. With this patch, the deployment cycle looks like this: 1. Worker pool is spawned (PID 1 in SDK container => worker pool ID = `1`). 2. Flink starts a job and a worker gets spun up with ID `1-1`. 3. The worker creates a temporary venv in `/opt/apache/beam-venv/beam-venv-worker-1-1` and deploys the artifact with dependencies. 4. Processing happens ... 5. Everything is cleaned up and a new job can be submitted. The venvs are bound to individual workers (or sets of workers if they have siblings) and are cleaned up as soon as they finish. This makes `multiProcessExactlyOnce()` obsolete, so it was removed. Additional care was taken to ensure a clean signal flow between individual components, so anything that would cause a premature `os.Exit()` or a `SIGKILL` to be sent was adjusted to allow for clean worker shutdown. fixes: #21123 ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-12164]: Add retry protection to DetectNewPartitions
body:
The original algorithm of the DetectNewPartitions is susceptible to failures, because it produces side effects on every try which is not  idempotent. Specifically, it marks the partitions as SCHEDULED in the Spanner database and outputs them. If there is a bundle commit failure, during retry, the already SCHEDULED partitions will not be picked up again.

We change the algorithm in this PR to always schedule partitions that have a created at timestamp greater than the one saved in the DetectNewPartitions restriction. When scheduling the partitions, this SDF will also claim the created at of such partitions, advancing the timestamp saved. If there is a bundle commit failure, the restriction timestamp won't be saved, thus the partitions in the bundle will be picked up again regardless of their state.

More information can be seen at: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1IQAOqLmGuIaOJc55NmfUckM4rDCXHAmxKNuRg6Ae07U/edit#heading=h.q3e0xrkg85ay

title: [BEAM-11971] Fix directrunner timer consistency
body:
- Replaces pushedBackTimers with the technique used in FnApiDoFnRunner.
- Removes buggy use of Concurrent* data structures (those data structures only provide weakly-consistent iteration, which violates assumptions in the DirectRunner)
- Fix a few bugs associated with looping timers

body:
We were pinning an older guava for _all_ configurations on a couple of projects that require it, unfortunately this breaks error-prone in some cases. This PR removes the pinned guava for `annotationProcessor` and `testAnnotationProcessor` configurations, so that error-prone checks can run. title: [BEAM-6744] Support implicitly setting project id in Go Dataflow runner
body:
The dataflow.go runner currently requires a project to be set via a flag. However, this can be inferred from the users config if they have set the `GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS` env var to point to a service account ([details here](https://cloud.google.com/docs/authentication/production#auth-cloud-explicit-go)). This updates the runner to respect that setting if a project is not explicitly supplied. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-13760] Add random component to default python dataflow job name
body:
Currently, the dataflow runner creates collisions if two jobs are created at the same microsecond. This change adds eight random alphanumeric characters to the end of the job name, which increases the number of simultaneously started jobs required for collision odds to be over 50% from 2 (as they would definitely collide now) to 2 million. This change also updates the unit test to account for the new name format. R: @TheNeuralBit ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-4032]Support staging binary distributions of dependency packages
body:
This PR changes how we stage packages mentioned in the `--requirements_file`. Prior to this, the default behavior was to download the source distributions of the packages specified in the `--requirements_file` during staging. The current behavior would be to download binary distributions(wheels) for packages specified in the `--requirements_file` without their sub-dependencies. To follow the prior behavior, set `--requirements_cache_only_sources`. Staging of the packages/pipeline dependencies can be skipped by setting `--requirements_cache=skip` during job submission. Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-11648] Share thread pool across RetryManager instances.
body:
RetryManager's have short lifetime (for example processElement). This means that many different threads are created instead of effectively reusing them. This is adds expense but also can result in many threads because the each individual thread lasts for up to 60 seconds and until the GC runs. **Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable.
